ThingDef.label: Ancient desk
ThingDef.description: Once used to crunch data, it is now completely inoperable. Its usable parts were smashed or looted long ago.

ThingDef.label: ruined dial home device
ThingDef.description: A shattered relic of alien engineering once used to command a Dwarfgate. Its crystals are burnt out, its control ring frozen in place—no dialing, no escape, just a reminder of what was lost. Scavengers might still pry a trace of naquadah from its husk, but it will probably never open a wormhole again.\n\nNote: With a deeper understanding of how DHDs function, it may be possible to bypass ancient protocols and use this to directly interface with a gate and dial home in case of emergency.

ThingDef.Name: Rimgate_AncientGestatorBase
ThingDef.label: ancient mech vat (base)
ThingDef.description: An ancient device capable of forming new mechanoids, or sustaining injured units while they rejuvenate.

li.triggeredMessage: A {0_labelShort} has emerged from a mech vat.

ThingDef.label: ancient replicator vat
ThingDef.description: An ancient compact gestation tank retrofitted for self-assembling Replicator units. Smaller footprint, same unpleasant surprise.

li.triggeredMessage: A {0_labelShort} has swarmed out of a replicator vat.

ThingDef.label: ancient replicator vat
ThingDef.description: An ancient compact gestation tank retrofitted for self-assembling Replicator units. Valuable parts are missing, and everything else is degraded to uselessness.

ThingDef.label: abandoned MALP
ThingDef.description: A disabled Tau'ri MALP. It is now completely inoperable, but its wiring runs and crystal beds still tell a story to anyone patient enough to listen.

li.activateDescString: Study the remains for usable patterns.
li.inspectString: Can be analyzed by a colonist with mechtech knowledge.
li.completedLetter:
By mapping the signal pathways and chassis mounting on the ruined MALP, {PAWN_labelShort} has revealed enough to begin our own design.

The old circuitry corroded completely under power-on testing, reducing the machine to scrap and smoke.

Research project(s) {RESEARCH} are now available at the bench.

ThingDef.label: dilapitated puddle jumper
ThingDef.description: A shattered Ancient scout vessel, its crystal conduits still pulsing faintly with residual subspace charge.\n\nMost of its systems are fused or looted, but the data spine and flight control lattice might still whisper secrets to anyone patient enough to listen.

li.completedLetter:
By studying the remnants of an Ancient Puddle Jumper, {PAWN_labelShort} has pieced together the groundwork for {RESEARCH} research.

The craft’s systems fused into glass when reactivated, erasing whatever ghost intelligence still lingered within.

Your engineers can now attempt to reproduce the vessel—without the existential dread of the original AI.
li.activateDescString: Analyze the dilapitated Ancient Puddle Jumper.
li.inspectString: Can be analyzed by a colonist.

ThingDef.label: deteriorating Tel'tak
ThingDef.description: A gutted Goa'uld courier craft: hull scorched, crystal racks shattered, and half the control studs fused from heat.\n\nUseless as a ship—but its systems still whisper how it once slipped through blockades and sensor nets.

li.completedLetter: By studying the remnants of a Goa’uld Tel’tak, {PAWN_labelShort} has pieced together the groundwork for {RESEARCH} research.\n\nThe remaining naquadah conduits overloaded during testing, disintegrating the hull and leaving only a crater where pride once stood.
li.inspectString: Can be analyzed by a colonist.

ThingDef.label: decaying dart
ThingDef.description:
A shattered Wraith Dart, its organic hull slowly liquefying.

Biopolymer veins still twitch with residual charge, and faint hums echo from what’s left of its stasis chamber.

It’s more carcass than craft now—but one that remembers how to fly.

li.completedLetter: By dissecting the remnants of a Wraith Dart, {PAWN_labelShort} has mapped its bio-alloy struts and energy lattice patterns, laying the foundation for {RESEARCH} research.\n\nThe craft’s organic frame began to decay the instant its neural core was exposed, hissing away into vapor as if offended by mortal curiosity.
li.inspectString: Can be analyzed by a colonist.

ThingDef.label: ancient geothermal generator
ThingDef.description: A ruined geothermal generator. It is now completely inoperable. Its usable parts were smashed or looted long ago.

ThingDef.label: toxic spout
ThingDef.description: A naturally-occurring break in the ground from which toxic fumes escape from an underground megastructure. It will regularly cause toxic fallout in the area.

ThingDef.Name: Rimgate_SupplyCrateBase
ThingDef.label: Supply crate
ThingDef.description: A sturdy, hermetically sealed supply crate used to store various goods and artifacts. These crates are usually found in ancient outposts and supply caches-but more commonly in the hands of explorers and scavengers.

ThingDef.label: cocoon pod
ThingDef.description:
A Wraith-grown pod for storing humans the way sensible people store meals: sealed, warm, and inconveniently still alive.

It cocoons the occupant in sticky biopolymer webbing and holds them in stasis for ages—perfect for long flights, emergencies, or a "snack later" plan. Victims are usually out cold, sometimes twitchy enough to beg or struggle.

Disturbingly, it’s padded and spine-friendly. Nothing says "ancient space vampire" like ergonomic prisoner storage.

ThingDef.label: Goa'uld Symbiote urn
ThingDef.description: A small urn that is hermetically sealed to contain a Goa'uld symbiote.

ThingDef.label: Goa'uld Queen Symbiote urn
ThingDef.description: A small urn that is hermetically sealed to contain a Goa'uld Queen symbiote.

ThingDef.label: feral symbiote basin
ThingDef.description:
A ruined Goa’uld spawning basin infested by escaped prim’ta and feral symbiotes. 

Without caretakers or conditioning, the brood within has devolved into violent, instinct-driven predators. As the surface barely ripples, something beneath is listening—and waiting. 

Approach too closely and the basin may erupt in a sudden, brutal ambush. 

Though most queens subjected to this state are irreversibly damaged, it is sometimes possible to reclaim a surviving queen from the remains. With exceptional care and retraining, such a specimen may yet be restored to produce stable, non-feral prim’ta once more.

ThingDef.label: Baal banner
ThingDef.description: A decorative banner emblazoned with the sigil of Baal, System Lord of the Goa'uld Empire. Such banners were often displayed in the halls of high-ranking Goa'uld to signify their power and status.

ThingDef.label: Tau'ri flag
ThingDef.description: A decorative banner bearing the emblem of the Tau'ri (humans from Earth). Such banners are often displayed to honor the resilience and achievements of humanity in the face of cosmic threats.
